skillTree.localised_description: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: Bone steeds pull dreaded chariots, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: The Pegasi were brought to Nehekhara from the Dread King's homelands. Now the reanimated bones still serve their Unliving masters.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fly.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: Elephants are unstoppable beasts, even more so when reanimated by dark magic.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.
This unit can fire while on the move.

effects.description: Spell number of uses: +2 for "Raise Dead" and "Raise Dead Upgraded"

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Skeleton Warriors
Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

effects.description: Effect range: +35% for "Master of the Dead"

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

Spell number of uses: +2 for "Raise Dead" and "Raise Dead Upgraded"

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Skeleton Warriors

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord of Undeath projects an aura of dominion that can wilt the most iron-willed mortals.
A dark pact has been made with darker Gods to guarantee victory.
Whereby the power of death itself is used to hold back the physical world.
The liche has discarded their life to achieve an existence as an immortal undead. As long as their will remains unbroken, they are almost impossible to destroy permanently.

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Not all kings of Nehekara stand against Nagash. Some have been seduced by the power Nagash offers his loyal subjects.

ui_effects.localised_text: Activates automatically when conditions are met
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

skillTree.localised_description: Necromancers follow in the footsteps of Nagash, but none ever reached his mastery. For many, this pursuit ends in the service of Nagash and for the most talented few, in lichedom.

effects.description: Cooldown: -25% to Lore of Vampires spells

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +15

skillTree.localised_description: In life, he marched ahead as one of the generals of the Dread Legion and even in death the soldiers heed his commands.
Through his disciples, Nagash increases his influence on the world of the living. And where Nagash has influence, the dead will not find any rest.
Countless Legions lay beneath the sands, waiting for Nagash or his servants to call them back to battle the living.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Royal Guards

skillTree.localised_description: It is not possible to defeat such unshakeable spirit once its owner's mind is made up.
Kill many and you *are* a conqueror; godhood is then but a protracted slaughter away...
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
He whose will transcends death can strike out from beyond the grave, to devastating effect.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Death is not an impedance to the strongest of wills.
Beware the scorpion's sting, hidden 'neath the desert sands yet always poised to strike.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: The promise of a glorious afterlife worthy of a courageous warrior keeps embattled troops focused on the grim task at hand.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Missile combat isn't always about attacking; knowing how to defend also pays dividends.

skillTree.localised_description: Death isn't necessarily the end; those who have pledged service must rise to fight again another day.

skillTree.localised_description: Formed by long campaigns and bloody slaughter in the stifling desert heat, the bond between steed and rider cannot be broken, even when death tries to intervene.

skillTree.localised_description: "The swift charioteers of the king. They who pursue the sovereign's foes on the day of his awakening."

skillTree.localised_description: Such evil creatures are desperate to spill mortal blood, and will speed along until they find some flesh to carve.

skillTree.localised_description: The Dark Magic-user can reanimate fearsome beasts to do his bidding.

skillTree.localised_description: It takes an iron will and unnatural - supernatural - strength to rally bound troops routed by magical means.
The many ranks of archers and artillery batteries will darken the sky and reap many souls.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +15% for Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Javelinmen, Royal Peltasts, Bone Throwers and Screaming Skull Ballistas units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The desert itself is his steed.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Fell Bats, Dire Wolves, Hexwraiths, Royal Guard Cavalry, Skeleton Chariot, Skeleton Archer Chariot, Skeleton Horsemen and Skeleton Horsemen Archers units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: A dream of glory attained through conquest great rages still, despite the dying of the light.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The power of death cannot be denied.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Skeletal Minotaurs, Skeletal Elephant, Mortis Engine, Bone Hydra and Bone Colossus units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Skeletal Minotaurs, Skeletal Elephant, Mortis Engine, Bone Hydra and Bone Colossus units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Dark litanies are uttered to restore the Tomb Kings' slain soldiers to a twisted, chattering imitation of life.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Some of war's spoils are more difficult to see but are just as valuable as gold or jewels.
This one scours the battlefields, plains and dunes for the vanquished dead, so that his armies may march at full strength once more.
These jars contain the remains of many Liche Priests, which are useful for raising and binding a new force.
Nehekhara's mummified rulers are awake, their eyes burning with balefire, their thirst for power, conquest and vengeance every bit as strong as they were in life.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: By which the Undead armies of Nehekhara may remain deathless, undying and forever hungry for slaughter.

effects.description:
Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -35% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the victor, the spoils. All of them. Always.
It stands watch over the land, lest the foe's insidious, opportunistic agents dare to strike.
Renowned among their allies and feared by enemies both mortal and otherwise, this Lord's every deed adds to their already legendary reputation.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Glory in your dark majesty, my lord."
Vampires and their liche-servants are devious creatures; manipulative with many mortal servants in their thrall.

effects.description:
Hero action cost: -10%
	(Heroes in local province)

Hero action success chance: +5%
	(Heroes in local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "They will tremble, my lord, oh, they will fear!"

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -4
	(enemy armies in local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Once forbidden knowledge is acquired, Necromancers and Vampires will jealously guard it from rivals' eyes.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
	(own army)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
Well built, robust. Powerful.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
Benevolent Tahoth imparts sacred knowledge and timeless wisdom to his people.
The Tomb Kings and their servants feel Khsar's wrath coursing through their Unliving veins.
Time itself cannot harm those who have defied death.
There are many perfectly-uttered litanies and precise incantations required to draw forth spirits from the Realm of Souls. This one knows them all.
This Liche Priest is so powerful he can tap energy directly from the Realm of Souls and direct it at will.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +6

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
